Method Detail

writeScribable

public void writeScribable(Scribable o)
                    throws IOException,
                           UnscribableNodeEncountered
Writes a scribable node to the output stream. Either the class or a class reference is written to the output file, followed by the scribed object.

Throws:
IOException
UnscribableNodeEncountered

writeImage

public void writeImage(BufferedImage b)
                throws IOException
writes out a buffered image. It is acceptable to pass in null since a byte is written to determine if there is an image or not. This writes out the raw image data, which can be a lot of disk space since there is no special compression being done for images.

Throws:
IOException

writeLossyImage

public void writeLossyImage(BufferedImage b,
                            float quality)
                     throws IOException
Writes the buffered image to the file using lossy JPG compression.

Parameters:
b - The image to save
quality - The quality of the output
Throws:
IOException
